projects.title: VS Code Cheatsheet
projects.description:
Chrome extension for people who work on VS Code
Chrome extension for Visual Studio Code shortcuts especially designed for MacOS. It shows three different commands every time a new tab is opened or tab is reloaded.

blogPosts.title: Copy-by-value Vs Copy-by-reference
blogPosts.description: Copy-by-value and copy-by-reference methods have always confused budding programmers. To understand the nuanced difference between the two types of copy we need to understand what happens in the memory after we assign a value to it.

blogPosts.title: Array methods
blogPosts.description: We are now going to have a look at a few Array methods which are commonly used.

blogPosts.title: Type Conversions
blogPosts.description: In JavaScript values are converted from one type to another. Many a times it is done by the language itself and is called implicit type conversion. However, sometimes we need to specifically tell the language to do it; it is known as explicit type conversion

blogPosts.title: Hashing in node
blogPosts.description: Hashes and salts mostly used before saving passwords in the database. This converts the plain text password into a random string. It is an irreversible conversion of strings of arbitrary length to hashed strings of fixed length.

name: Yash Joshi
about:
Hi, I am Yash Joshi from Gujrat. I was raised in Mumbai and am currently staying here with my folks. 

I studied Science in my Junior college, so obviously, I am clueless about the subject because I had different priorities back then. 

I later pursued a hospitality management degree and worked for two years in the hotel industry. This experience was fundamental in developing my communication skills, which means I can shoot the bull with almost anyone. I enjoy cooking and learning foreign languages. I can speak and write basic Spanish.

During my work, I realized that the hotel industry was not the right fit for me. So, I decided to explore the world of coding, and incidentally, I was offered the opportunity to join AltCampus. I spent one-year learning software development and now am a Full-stack Software developer (it still seems unreal when I say it out loud). In hindsight, this opportunity came my way at the right time. I am currently working as a Software Engineer at Bigbinary. 

You will generally see me with my headphones on, bobbing my head in tune to the music. I also enjoy writing songs, short stories, and poems and am known to doodle away my time. I would love to master playing a musical instrument and have tried my hand (and lungs) at the guitar and flute. I would love to hone my skills further in Spanish and French.

I am thankful for the opportunity to learn at AltCampus, which has helped me develop my coding skills, enhanced my soft skills, and exposed me to a great community that I will always cherish.

name: Kabir Nazir
about:
I'm a software developer with over 5 years of experience in building web and mobile applications.

I began my career as an Android developer, building apps for startups from scratch and scaling them for 100k+ users. I later attended a Bootcamp in the Himalayas, where I upskilled myself in full-stack web development. Currently, I work as a hiring manager for BigBinary, recruiting for multiple roles in tech.

In my spare time, I like to read books, play games (board, mobile, console), or learn something new from the Internet. I try to trek 1-2 times per year.

blogPosts.title: How to make a simple To-Do Application using JS-DOM
blogPosts.description: Ive been learning JavaScript since 34 weeks here at AltCampus. My journey till now has got me learn topics such as string methods, array methods, etc in Javascript and now Im onto Document Object Model. The DOM is an object-oriented representation of the web page, which can be modified with a scripting language such as JavaScript.

blogPosts.title: Theming Web Applications Using Styled-Components
blogPosts.description: Hello all! Its been a while I wrote an article so here I am today! You must have seen Dark Mode in most of the applications nowadays. Some apps even support fully customisable theme. Ever thought how theming works on the go. Well, with Styled-Components its pretty simple.

blogPosts.title: All you need to know about middlewares in Express JS
blogPosts.description: Hello peeps! So, Ive been learning Backend Development in NodeJs since last two weeks. Well Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a web browser. And Express JS is a web application framework for Node JS.

name: Shivam Chahar
about:
HI, I'm Shivam Chahar
I am currently working as a Software Engineer at BigBinary.
experienceAtAltCampus:
My experience at AltCampus was amazing in every way. I learnt the fundamentals of web development in depth which enabled me to build useful things.

The course is well designed and everything is taught at a steady pace, we also had assignments and weekly demos where we applied the things that we learnt to build things and show it to everyone.

Technical things aside, The most valuable thing about AltCampus is its community. I got a chance to meet people from all over India with different backgrounds, made a lot of friends. I got a chance to live in the mountains and experience nature more closely which is something most of the people miss in the cities.

AltCampus helped me grow as a person, I thank all of the mentors who were more like brothers to me for teaching me and supporting me throughout the course.

name: Shashank Bhatotia
about: I am a software engineer at BigBinary.
experienceAtAltCampus: AltCampus is affordable and opens the door to have a career in web development. AltCampus's scheduled program, weekly demo sessions, hackathons, code reviews, etc. provided the necessary milieu to set the ball rolling, and at the same time being challenging enough to push the limits. The peer-based learning helped in setting the right perspective to gauge progress. The program demanded a certain level of self-motivation to adapt to different mental models and learn quickly.  The full stack web development program at AltCampus, had the rigorousness in its curriculum to equip fairly  for interviewing and getting a job.

projects.title: Kinder-Joy
projects.description: A quiz application for kids. The concept of the game is to match some words to their appropriate box. the application is built using react DND(drag and drop) library. so they have to drag the words and drop into the correct box. there can be three wrong attempts. Every wrong attempt will reduce your attempts. and Every correct attempt will increase your score by 10.

blogPosts.title: Prototype in JavaScript
blogPosts.description: Whenever we create a new function in JavaScript, JavaScript engine by default adds a prototype property to it this property is an object and we call it prototype object this prototype object has a constructor property which points back to our function and another property call __proto__ which is an object.

name: Ankireddy Naveen
about: I'm Naveen from Andhrapradesh,I'm passionate about doing anything that helpful for my happiness and peace.
experienceAtAltCampus:
AltCampus plays a major role in my life, AltCampus taught me how to code,Altcampus taught me how to express, Altcampus gave me a lot of best friends, Altcampus encourage me when I was in trouble, Altcampus helped me when I was in problems , Altcampus console me when I was In sad, Altcampus gave me a job , Altcampus teach me  that my 22 years previous experience can't give, I'm not successful right now but the vision to focus and achieve given by Altcampus is in my bag ,One day I can achieve what I can , AltCampus taught me how to speak Hindi and English also.
Thank you Prashath Bhaiya to opened the gates let me in to AltCampus.
Love you AltCampus .... forever!
